alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 03 at 2:22PM PST until March 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... * CHANGES...While the heavy snow will move in mid-morning Saturday, the initial push of lighter snow may begin near sunrise. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, except 2 to 4 feet above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, with up to 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds may cause tree damage and lead to power outages. Blowing and drifting snow may bring near zero visibility at times and rapid disorientation if attempting to travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snow loading on top of very deep existing snowpack may create unusual hazards including, but not limited to: structural instabilities, roofalanches, fire hydrant access problems, delayed first responders, and shelter in place orders. There are two periods to watch for heavier rates of snowfall, where rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour are possible: Saturday afternoon and again before sunrise Sunday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
